answers.answer: i have a son who was born with cerabral poisy and his hands were shakin uncontroleable when u moved him or what ever u did drs put this down to ataxi cerabral poisy i think u r best seeing or speaking to a neuro dr as they can say for certain what it is

question: My 4 (5 in April) year old son has shaking/trembling hands almost always.  He has be tested for diabetes twice (I had gestational diabetes when pregnant with him) and said to be negative.  He's on the hyper side and has trouble sitting still in pre-school but not much worse than other kids.  Maybe I should post this question to another forum other than neurology but I don't know what it could be.  He could just be super sensitive to blood sugar drops, hot/cold-- maybe it's an adrenalin issue or even blood pressure.  I'm baffled and a little worried.  It's not normal for a little kid to have trembling hands.  Got any ideas
title: 4 year old son - shaking
